intro: Schnella trinitensis, commonly known as the Trinidad snail, is a species of air-breathing land snail. It belongs to the family Achatinellidae and is native to the island of Trinidad. The shell of Schnella trinitensis is typically small, spiral-shaped, and has a smooth or slightly ribbed surface. It thrives in humid, tropical environments, often found in forested areas. Due to habitat loss and predation, this species is considered endangered and is of significant ecological importance.
